    • Method Detail

      • copyNextMessage

        public Proxy_Record.CopyStatus copyNextMessage(byte[] messageBuf,
                                               int msgPtr)
        TODO - Not tested - Does this replace the original read method? Copy a message from the current TLSRecord into a buffer. It also takes into account messages that are fragmented across multiple TLSRecords.
        Parameters:
        messageBuf - The buffer to copy it in to
        msgPtr - The offset into the buffer with which to start writing data from.

      • read

        public int read(java.io.InputStream i)
        TODO - Tested - works. Read in a given TLSRecord from the input stream i. The header is stored in recordHeader and the TLS Record payload is stored in tlsRecordPayload.
        Parameters:
        i - - The input
        Returns:
        - Whether or not the read was successful. -1 indicates end of stream, -2 for reading less than 5 bytes of the header.

      • write

        public boolean write(java.io.OutputStream o)
        Write a given TLSRecord to the outputstream o. Read must have been invoked on this object before attempting to write it to an output stream.
        Parameters:
        o -

      • getRecordPayloadLength

        public int getRecordPayloadLength()

      • getNextMessageLength

        public int getNextMessageLength()
        By taking the current position inside the payload as the starting position of a message, calculate the size of the next message. It does not move the pointer into the payload.
        Returns:

      • getNextMessageType

        public int getNextMessageType()
        By taking the current position inside the payload as the starting position of a TLS message, return the type of the message
        Returns:
        The 8-bit value corresponding to the type of Message inside the TLSRecord.
